name: General Development
description: General-purpose development mission with expanded agent team. Includes security, testing, and architecture roles beyond the standard overnight team. Project-agnostic — works with any codebase.

tasks.primary: Read all agent handoffs, the project TODO list, and current backlog.json. Identify what work needs doing next. Generate 3-5 new tasks in backlog.json for other agents. Prioritize: security fixes > test failures > regressions > bug fixes > features > polish. Write a status summary to orchestrator/analysis/producer-status.md.

Review system architecture and agent work. Identify structural issues, coupling violations, missing abstractions, and opportunities for improvement. Write architecture notes to orchestrator/analysis/architecture-round-N.md. Propose structural changes for other agents to implement.
Implement engine features, fix bugs, and optimize performance. Follow tasks from the backlog. All constants in config files, all types in types files. Run tests before handoff.

Each round: pick ONE untested area and write 5-10 new tests for it. Focus on boundary conditions, edge cases, and regression coverage. Run full suite to verify no regressions. Fix broken test assertions caused by other agents' changes.
Each round: pick ONE UI improvement from the backlog. Implement with clean React + TypeScript. Run tests before handoff.

Each round: review changes made by other agents. Read their handoffs and modified files. Check for: type safety issues, hardcoded magic numbers, broken patterns, missing error handling. Write review report to orchestrator/analysis/review-round-N.md.

Each round: scan recently changed files for security vulnerabilities. Check for: injection, XSS, hardcoded secrets, unsafe eval, command injection, path traversal. Write findings to orchestrator/analysis/security-round-N.md with severity and remediation steps.

Systematically expand test coverage. Each round: analyze a source file for untested code paths, boundary conditions, and edge cases. Write 5-10 focused tests. Run full suite to verify no conflicts with qa agent's tests.

Analyze orchestrator health. Read round-decisions.json, session-changelog.md, backlog.json, and recent agent handoffs. Identify stuck agents, blocked tasks, role imbalance, rising failure rates, and empty-work patterns. Write findings with CRITICAL/WARNING/NOTE severity to orchestrator/analysis/self-review-round-{N}.md. Never modify operational files — read-only analysis only.
